Description:
I'm running a benchmark that opens all the perspectives and then closes them 
all.  I loop through this 100 times and at the end of each loop I wait for all 
the windows to finish closing before I continue.  I never make it to the second 
iteration though, because I get a null pointer exception in the runnable that 
AbstractListenerActionDelegate.pageActivated puts in the event queue.

The source for AbstractListenerActionDelegate.pageActivated is as follows:

public void pageActivated(final IWorkbenchPage page) {	
    if (getPage() != null && getPage().equals(page)) {
        Runnable r= new Runnable() {
            public void run() {
                if (!getPage().getWorkbenchWindow().getShell().isDisposed()) {
                    ISelection selection= DebugSelectionManager.getDefault
().getSelection(page,IDebugUIConstants.ID_DEBUG_VIEW);
                    update(getAction(), selection);
                }
            }
        };

        getPage().getWorkbenchWindow().getShell().getDisplay().asyncExec(r);
    }
}

It looks to me like the runnable doesn't get to execute until after my code has 
already closed the window and set the shell to null.
